definitions.definition: A powerful squeezing or twisting action.
definitions.example: I grasped his hand and gave it a grateful wring.

definitions.definition: To squeeze or twist (something) tightly so that liquid is forced out. See also wring out.
definitions.example: I didn’t have a towel so I just wrung my hair dry.

definitions.definition: To extract (a liquid) from something wet, especially cloth, by squeezing and twisting it.
definitions.example: Put the berries into a cheesecloth and wring the juice into a bowl.

definitions.definition: To obtain (something from or out of someone or something) by force.
To draw (something from or out of someone); to generate (something) as a response.
To hold (something) tightly and press or twist.
definitions.example: to wring one's hands (with worry, etc.)

definitions.definition: To cause pain or distress to (someone / one's heart, soul, etc.).
To slide two ultraflat surfaces together such that their faces bond.
To twist, as if in pain.
To give an incorrect meaning to (words, teachings, etc.).
To subject (someone) to extortion; to afflict or oppress in order to enforce compliance.
To bend or strain out of its position.
A device for pressing or compressing, especially for cider.
